item.title: Parent Constraint to Last - Maya Python
item.description:
Snippet to constraint all selected nodes to the last selected.

1 import maya.cmds as cmds
2 nodes = cmds.ls(sl=True)
3 myParent = grps[-1]
4 grps.pop()
5 for node in nodes:
6     cmds.parentConstraint(parent, myParent, mo=True, weight=1) ## mo = False if you do not want to maintain offset

item.title: Group Nodes - Maya Python
item.description:
Hey guys!

Here is a quick snippet to just group nodes under their own little group hierarchie, which will provide us with a driver group and a xform group. The xform group is the one that contains the offset values from the parent node while the driver is the group we will use for all connections needed (sometime I even have two driver groups).

 1 ## Imports
 2 import maya
 3 import maya.cmds as cmds
 4 
 5 ## Creates a locator aligned to each of the selected objects and groups the locators to zero it.
 6 objs = cmds.ls(sl=True)
 7 
 8 for obj in objs:
 9     myParent = cmds.listRelatives(obj, p = True)
10     myGroup = cmds.group(empty=True, name = "xform_" + obj)
11     if myParent != None: cmds.parent(myGroup, myParent)
12     orient = cmds.orientConstraint(obj, myGroup)
13     point = cmds.pointConstraint(obj, myGroup)
14     cmds.delete(orient, point)
15     myDrGroup = cmds.group(empty=True, name = "driver_" + obj)
16     orient = cmds.orientConstraint(obj, myDrGroup)
17     point = cmds.pointConstraint(obj, myDrGroup)
18     cmds.delete(orient, point)
19     cmds.parent(obj, myDrGroup)
20     cmds.parent(myDrGroup, myGroup)
21 
22 ## END.

item.title: Find Verts Weighted to Bone Function
item.description:
Here is a little function I wrote that will go through all selected meshes and find all the vertices weighted to a given bone. I had to write this to find all the meshes that had a specific bone in their skin mod, but not just that! I needed to know which of those meshes had verts weighted to this specific bone.

The main task was to remove the influence of that bone from all meshes not necessarily remove the bone as the engine export strips out any bone that has no vertices weighted to it.

There are also ways to get the influenced verts of selected bone by hand, but I needed a way to go through hundreds to thousands of meshes in a timely manner.

 1 fn findWeightedVertsFn theBone =
 2 (
 3     max modify mode
 4     clearListener()
 5     theAr = selection as array
 6     for obj in theAr do
 7     (
 8         select obj
 9         skinMods = getclassinstances Skin target:obj
10         for s = 1 to skinMods.count where skinMods.count > 0 do
11         (
12             skel = skinOps.getnumberbones skinMods[s]
13             verts = skinOps.getNumberVertices skinMods[s]
14             for x = 1 to skel do
15             (
16                 If (skinOps.getBoneName skinMods[s] x 0) == theBone do
17                 (
18                     skinOps.selectBone skinMods[s] x
19                     skinOps.selectVerticesByBone skinMods[s]
20 
21                     selectedVerts = #()
22                     for v = 1 to verts do
23                     (
24                         theVert = skinOps.IsVertexSelected skinMods[s] v
25                         if theVert == 1 do append selectedVerts v
26                     )
27 
28                     if selectedVerts.count > 0 do
29                     (
30                         print (obj.name + " has " + (selectedVerts.count as string) + " verts weighted to " + theBone)
31                     )
32                 )
33             )
34         )
35     )
36     clearselection()
37 )
38 
39 /*
40 findWeightedVertsFn "The Bone Name"
41 */

item.title: Create FK Chain - Maya Python
item.description:
Hey guys! first rigging script for python in maya! pretty simple, it creates a FK chain from selected joints with flags to align the controllers to world or to the Joint. Wrote this script to do Gainer's(Sasktel) spine rig in Maya ( I am re-rigging him in Maya.)

 1 # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 2 # Rigging Modules
 3 # -- Method Rigger (Maya)
 4 #
 5 # By: Felipe[PePeTD]Nogueira
 6 # ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 7 
 8 ## Imports
 9 import maya
10 import maya.cmds as cmds
11 
12 # Create FK Chain rig Module.
13 # createFKChain(world) - if left unchanged, world = True by default.
14 # -------------------------------------------------------------------
15 def createFKChain(world=True):
16     ## Grab current selection (!warning this function works on any type of node).
17     joints = cmds.ls(sl=True)
18     locators = []
19     circles = []
20     groups = []
21     counter = 0
22 
23     ## Goes through the newly created list of joints and creates a locator and controller
24     ## for each node grouping and constrainning it all accordinly.
25     for joint in joints:
26         curPos = cmds.xform(joint, q=True, ws=True, t=True)
27 
28         ## Creates the locator at the position of the node, Centers its pivot, and freezes it.
29         curLoc = cmds.spaceLocator(p=curPos)
30         locators.append(curLoc)
31         cmds.CenterPivot(curLoc)
32         cmds.parent(curLoc, joint)
33         cmds.makeIdentity(curLoc, apply=True, t=1, r=1, s=1)
34 
35         ## Creates the Circle shape at the position of the node and aligns it to the node depending
36         ## on the state of (world) if true then aligns it to world if false the circle shapes will be
37         ## aligned to the node(joint).
38 
39         ## Align the control curves to world or to each given node according to the state of (world).
40         if world == True:
41             curCircle = cmds.circle(nr=[0, 0, 1], r=1, c=curPos)
42             circles.append(curCircle)
43             cmds.CenterPivot(curCircle)
44             cmds.makeIdentity(curCircle, apply=True, t=1, r=1, s=1)
45             curGroup = cmds.duplicate(curCircle[0], rr=True, rc=True, po=True)
46             curGroup[0] = cmds.rename(curGroup[0], (curGroup[0]+"_Grp"))
47             groups.append(curGroup)
48             cmds.parent(curCircle[0], curGroup[0])
49         else:
50             curCircle = cmds.circle(nr=[1, 0, 0], r=1)
51             circles.append(curCircle)
52             cmds.parent(curCircle[0], joint)
53             cmds.CenterPivot(curCircle)
54             cmds.makeIdentity(curCircle, apply=False, t=1, r=1, s=1)
55             cmds.parent(curCircle[0], w=True)
56             curGroup = cmds.duplicate(curCircle[0], rr=True, rc=True, po=True)
57             curGroup[0] = cmds.rename(curGroup[0], (curGroup[0]+"_Grp"))
58             groups.append(curGroup)
59             cmds.parent(curCircle[0], curGroup[0])
60 
61         ## Checks to see if we are on the first node or not and does the appropriate tasks.
62         if counter == 0:
63             cmds.parent(curLoc[0], w=True)
64             rigGroup = cmds.duplicate(curLoc[0], rr=True, rc=True, po=True)
65             rigGroup[0] = cmds.rename(rigGroup[0], (rigGroup[0]+"_Grp"))
66             cmds.parent(joint, rigGroup[0])
67             cmds.parent(curLoc[0], rigGroup[0])
68         else:
69             cmds.parent(curLoc[0], locators[counter-1][0])
70             cmds.parent(curGroup[0], circles[counter-1][0])
71 
72         ## Finally we parentContraint the joint to the locator.
73         cmds.parentConstraint(curCircle[0], curLoc[0], mo=True)
74         cmds.parentConstraint(curLoc[0], joint, mo=True)
75 
76         counter += 1
77 
78 createFKChain(world=False)
79 ## END.

item.title: Constraint Functions - 3DS Max
item.description:
In the past years I started creating my own library of functions and scripts that would automate a lot of the processes that I often use when rigging characters to speed up the rigging process even more.

I have so many rigging functions that one day I realized I could create an entire humanoid rig in a matter of minutes by using all these functions as long as I had a skeleton created.

In time I will be releasing a function library for all of you to check it out, meanwhile, here is a little preview of some of the functions I use often, the Look-At constraint could use more work but the Position Constraint, Orientation Constraint and Path Constraint Functions are perfect for pretty much anything that I would use them for.

  1 -- Position Constraint
  2 -- PosConst (Affected Node) (Target Node) (Target Weight)
  3 -- (newCon:true if fresh constrain, false if adding target to existing constrain)
  4 fn PosConst obj target tarWeight newCon:true =
  5 (
  6     if newCon == true then
  7     (
  8         Pc = Position_Constraint()
  9         obj.pos.controller.available.controller = Pc
 10         posConstraint = Pc.constraints
 11         posConstraint.appendtarget target tarWeight
 12     )
 13     else
 14     (
 15         obj.position.controller.Position_Constraint.appendtarget target tarWeight
 16     )
 17     obj.pos.controller.setactive 3
 18 )
 19 
 20 -- Look-At Constraint
 21 -- LookConst (Affected Node) (Target Node) (upNode:UpNode Node) (Target Weight)
 22 -- (newCon:true if fresh constrain, false if adding target to existing constrain)
 23 fn LookConst obj target upNode tarWeight newCon:true =
 24 (
 25     if newCon == true then
 26     (
 27         Lc = LookAt_Constraint()
 28         obj.rotation.controller.available.controller = Lc
 29         locConstraint = Lc.constraints
 30         locConstraint.appendtarget target tarWeight
 31         Lc.upnode_world = false
 32         Lc.pickUpNode = upNode
 33         Lc.lookat_vector_length = 0
 34     )
 35     else
 36     (
 37         obj.rotation.controller.LookAt_Constraint.appendtarget target tarWeight
 38     )
 39     obj.rotation.controller.setactive 3
 40 )
 41 
 42 -- Orientation Constraint
 43 -- OrientConst (Affected Node) (Target Node) (Target Weight) (keepOff: keep off-set True or False)
 44 -- (newCon:true if fresh constrain, false if adding target to existing constrain)
 45 fn OrientConst obj target tarWeight keepOff:false newCon:true =
 46 (
 47     if newCon == true then
 48     (
 49         Oc = Orientation_Constraint()
 50         obj.rotation.controller.available.controller = Oc
 51         orientConstraint = Oc.constraints
 52         orientConstraint.appendtarget target tarWeight
 53         Oc.relative = keepOff
 54     )
 55     else
 56     (
 57         obj.rotation.controller.Orientation_Constraint.appendtarget target tarWeight
 58     )
 59     obj.rotation.controller.setactive 3
 60 )
 61 
 62 -- Path Constraint
 63 -- PathConst (Affected Node) (Target Node) (Target weight) (Percent on path)
 64 fn PathConst obj target tarWeight percent =
 65 (
 66     Pc = Path_Constraint()
 67     obj.pos.controller.available.controller = Pc
 68     Pc.path = target
 69     deletekeys obj
 70     Pc.follow = true
 71     Pc.percent = percent
 72     obj.pos.controller.setactive 3
 73 )
 74 
 75 
 76 -- Freeze Transform -- Function created by Mathieson Facer.
 77 -- FreezeTransform (Obj to Freeze)
 78 fn FreezeTransform Obj =
 79 (
 80     local curObj = Obj
 81     if classof CurObj.rotation.controller != Rotation_Layer do
 82     (
 83         -- freeze rotation
 84         curObj.rotation.controller = Euler_Xyz()
 85         curObj.rotation.controller = Rotation_list()
 86         curObj.rotation.controller.available.controller = Euler_xyz()
 87 
 88         /* "Localization on" */
 89         CurObj.rotation.controller.setname 1 "Frozen Rotation"
 90         CurObj.rotation.controller.setname 2 "Zero Euler XYZ"
 91 
 92         /* "Localization off" */
 93         CurObj.rotation.controller.SetActive 2
 94     )
 95 
 96     if classof CurObj.position.controller != Position_Layer do
 97     (
 98         -- freeze position
 99         CurObj.position.controller = Bezier_Position()
100         CurObj.position.controller = position_list()
101         CurObj.position.controller.available.controller = Position_XYZ()
102 
103         /* "Localization on" */
104         CurObj.position.controller.setname 1 "Frozen Position"
105         CurObj.position.controller.setname 2 "Zero Pos XYZ"
106 
107         /* "Localization off" */
108         CurObj.position.controller.SetActive 2
109 
110         -- position to zero
111         CurObj.Position.controller[2].x_Position = 0
112         CurObj.Position.controller[2].y_Position = 0
113         CurObj.Position.controller[2].z_Position = 0
114     )
115 )
